intro: Trigonella brahuica, commonly known as Indian cumin, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, lens-shaped seeds that are rich in essential oils and nutrients. It thrives in dry, warm climates and is often cultivated for its aromatic seeds used in culinary and medicinal applications. Trigonella brahuica is also valued for its potential health benefits, including antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
